Fields.DialogueText: From that smile, I'm guessing you've got good news.
Yes, Captain. Repairs to the number 4 engine and propeller shaft are complete.
Excellent, Officer Rahal. The shipyard didn't waste any time, did they?
Start the pre-underway checklist for our departure.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Sounds like the shipyard took care of everything.
Miss Wichita! You overheard the news about the repairs?
Miss Wichita?
Yes, yes I did. Good news, isn't it?
You bet!
Go get started on that checklist, Officer Rahal. The fleet needs us at sea.
Aye aye, Captain.
Are you all right, Wichita? The major repairs are complete, so it follows that you should be feeling pretty good.
Wonderful, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Glad to hear it. I want our Belle in top shape and ready for anything.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were still feeling a bit off.
You have that distant look in your eye, Wichita...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always ready to throw punches at Morganas!
It's good that you do know better, Captain. Besides, if I didn't know better, I'd say you were worrying too much.
Oh? No disrespect intended, Captain. I just had something on my mind.
We still have some time before we get underway, right?
I'd wager so. Officer Rahal is painfully thorough with those checklists.
Good. I think I'll go out and walk the rails for a bit. Watch the shoreline...
Oh, and make sure the shipyard is cleaning everything up, of course. I'd hate to leave a mess for the next ship that has to come in for repairs here.
Last minute sightseeing, then. I'll see you on the bridge when it's time to cast off our lines.
Some things are hard to fix - especially when we'll be shooting our way out of here any minute now.
@BATTLE
There! See those on the horizon?
Damn, they're closing fast. How did we not see them until now?
The shoreline? We're in no danger of hitting the shore, Captain.
Wrong horizon, Wichita. Quit gazing astern, and look out in front of us.
Morgana scum... ruining my sightseeing, as usual. Let's see how they like a fully-armed heavy cruiser busting up their little pack!
@BATTLE
We drove them off, Wichita.
*BOOM*
Wichita, cease fire. All enemy contacts have been defeated.
*BOOM*
Wichita, cease fire!
Oh? Yes, of course.

Fields.MenuText: When I tell you to cease fire, that means stop shooting.
Do we need to go back to the shipyard and get your hearing checked?
You need to pay attention to my orders, Wichita.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I saw a few more out there. My mistake, Captain. I wasn't aware.
Can the shipyard do that? I wasn't aware.
When I start shooting, it can be hard to stop. I'll try to pay better attention, Captain.
We'll talk about this later. For now, let's get to the debrief.
I thought I might find you here. Officer Coltrain says that you've been watching seagulls for over an hour.
Officer Coltrain is mistaken.
But here you are.
I was only watching seagulls for half an hour. Then I was looking at clouds, and waiting for Ellis to come back in his scout plane.
Ellis? His reconnaissance flight isn't scheduled to return yet.
That's why I'm still here waiting. I like to watch him return to the ship.
Sometimes he does an extra loop de loop before he lands, and I like to imagine what that would feel like if I were flying the plane.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose it's fine, as long as your other duties are caught up.
Imagine if planes had Belles, too!
If something isn't right, you can talk to me about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh...
Yes! That would be incredible!
Shipyards can't fix everything, Captain.
Gunnery practice starts in just a few minutes. I should probably get down to the weather decks and get ready.
Put that keen eyesight to work, Wichita. Turn our gunners into sharpshooters, right?
Right.
*ALARM*
Oh! Morganas. I can sense them moving in from our starboard beam.
So much for gunnery practice.
Practice just became a final exam. No substitute for the real thing!
I like the enthusiasm. Let's throw some good punches, Wichita.
@BATTLE
Why is everybody standing around the Mark 55 gun like this? Is something wrong with it?
Attention on deck!
At ease, Officer Coltrain. Can somebody tell me what's going on here?
I'll be right out, Captain!
Wichita?
She climbed inside-
She climbed inside the gun barrel? It's an eight inch gun, Officer Coltrain. Even Miss Wichita couldn't fit in there.
Well, more like she... she... phased inside of it. Like a...
Like a what? Like a ghost?
Captain, Miss Wichita doesn't like--
-- doesn't like being called a ghost.
What can I do for you, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I saw everybody standing about and wanted to know what it was all about.
So... is the gun barrel clean? It must be handy to check a gun from the inside like that.
Are you trying to get yourself shot out of a cannon again?

Fields.DialogueText: A simple inspection, Captain, and a demonstration of what a Belle can do.
My inspection is complete. This gun is in perfect working order, Captain.
I promise you that I remember your strict orders against such a thing. I wouldn't disobey you, Captain.
Back to work, everybody.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Wichita, I'd like to...
*ALARM*
First things first, Captain. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
And that, my good officers, is the proper way to defeat an enemy ship! That concludes today's gunnery training.
Does anybody have questions about our tactics or techniques?
So, let me make sure I understand you correctly, Miss Wichita...
Go ahead, Officer Rahal.
The art of gunnery is to just... shoot as much as possible?
You weren't listening.
Maybe we could listen if our ears weren't ringing so much, Miss Wichita. I lost count of how many times we fired the guns.
What? HUH?
I said, "Maybe we could listen if our EARS weren't ringing so much!"
Captain, could you explain it to them any better?

Fields.MenuText: One accurate shot makes all the difference.
The more you shoot, the more chances you have to hit. Keep throwing punches.
Never stop firing until EVERYTHING is full of holes!

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly what I meant. Listen up...
Exactly. Officers, you should listen to your Captain.
Now THAT'S the kind of enthusiasm I want them to hear!
Which would all be a lot easier to do if we could HEAR anything!
WHAT did you say?!
Time to put theory to practice, crew! We have Morganas! Strike while the lesson is fresh!
@BATTLE
Are you all right, Captain? You're stumbling a bit around the bridge today.
My sea legs forgot how to work, but I'll be fine.
Your balance? Should I get the ship's doctor?
My equilibrium is a bit off. Maybe it's because my ears are still ringing a bit from gunnery practice.
Oh...
And that scrape with the Morganas afterwards, of course. We did a lot of shooting.
We sure did!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could take it easy on the guns a little bit.
You push the crew pretty hard. You push yourself hard, too.
Wichita, do you know what "ceasefire" means?

Fields.DialogueText: Take it easy?! But in combat we give everything we have!
And my Captain, apparently.
It means to... Oh. That's not what you meant, is it? You didn't want a straight answer.
Sorry, Captain. I should have realized that you were tired from all of the guns.
Well, my head is still ringing from that last fight. Your guns never let up once. Are you all right?
I could use a rest, but I can push a little longer.
I see, however, that it's taken a toll on your inner ears.. Your legs really are all... wobbly.
I'll be fine in a minute.
*ALARM*
Don't look at me like that. I said I'll be fine.
I hope so. We have to be.
Just promise me that you'll stop shooting as soon as the fight is over, all right?
Agreed... but not a minute sooner than that!
@BATTLE
Why won't this paperwork stop? My eyes are going all crooked and blurry...
Trouble getting your admin chores finished?
I am reviewing our supply requests before they are transmitted off the ship.
I didn't know that was part of your job.
Officer Coltrain has been overloaded with work lately, and I offered to help.
He's on the bridge standing watch so much that he wouldn't have time to finish these before our supply ship rendezvous.
I'm sure he appreciates the help. You're always quick to assist. That's... a quality I admire about you.
Sweet of you to say, my dear captain. Thanks.
Excuse me?
Sorry for the outburst, Captain. It's just that... no matter how many times I sign these forms, they never seem to end!
I can answer that one for you. You're trying to sign those papers with a straw of wheat instead of a pen.
Huh?
Yup. That little shock of wheat you carry around sometimes? I noticed you've been trying to write with it for the past hour.
I am? I... I... I am!
No wonder nothing happens when I sign my name...

Fields.MenuText: You need some rest, Miss Wichita. Consider that an order from a concerned Captain.
What's the matter? Can't handle the strain?
So, Belles get tired like the rest of us on board the ship!

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose I have been up for a while.
That sounds like a challenge, Captain!
Unfortunately, yes. We have our limits, too.
Maybe an hour or two in the rack would help.
Get some sleep, Wichita. Everybody needs it.
Once I'm done with this paperwork...
Oh, right. No pen.
Right.
Guess I'll turn in, then. I'll be in my cabin if you need me. Or when Morganas show up.
I'm just as tired as you are, so put that out of your mind. We need rest.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Damn...
UGH! Why aren't the stacks of paper getting any smaller?!
You look refreshed, Coltrain. Did you get some good sleep?
Yes, and a fresh cup of coffee. Ready to take my watch on the bridge!
Excellent.
Honestly, though, I feel like a few more hours in the rack wouldn't hurt.
We could all use a little more, but it's good you were able to rest. We fight better that way.
Speaking of which, here comes our Belle.
Pssst... Captain, are you saying our Belle really IS a "witch?"
Please don't start that again.
If you ever feel it necessary to whisper your words, Officer Coltrain, take that urge as a clue.
A clue?
Yes, a clue. A clue that perhaps you should reconsider what you are about to say.

Fields.MenuText: Ha! You've been caught!
Don't start a fight, Miss Wichita.
Good advice, Wichita. I want all of us to think about what we say.

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't, Captain. I get plenty of fighting from the Morganas.
Don't worry about it, Captain.
Never forget, with my supernatural powers I can hear things from a mile away.
I'm sorry, Miss Wichita. Maybe I'm not as rested as I thought, and I wasn't thinking clearly.
I didn't take offense. Here, have some popcorn.
Thanks...
Are you all right?
*ALARM*
I'm always ready for a fight, Captain. As long as I have ammunition, my guns will fire.
About that...
No time, Captain. The Morganas are almost here!
@BATTLE
Clear skies and good weather, Captain?
Clear of Morganas, at least. Here you go, Officer Rahal. Take the binoculars and see for yourself.
I have something for you, too.
What's this that you're handing me?
Ah, another requisition.
Yes, Captain. I don't want to rush you, but we need to transmit this to the logistics branch quickly to ensure this is procured for our next resupply.
Then I'll review it right now. Let's see...
Normal food and consumables.
Lube oil.
Repair parts for the number 3 turbine.
What's this? Ammunition again?
Yes, Captain. We've already exhausted two thirds of our combat patrol loadout.

Fields.MenuText: We have guns for a reason, Officer Rahal. Let's keep them firing.
We've seen a lot of action. It makes sense that we burn up our ammo quickly.
Wichita takes a while to stop shooting.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain.
That, and Miss Wichita's penchant for shooting non-stop.
Sometimes it seems like she never stops at all.
Miss Wichita is... thorough when it comes to gunfire. She shoots hard and works hard, Officer Rahal. Let's get her some more ammo.
There, I've signed the last one for release.
Thanks, Captain. I'll get these to the radio room and transmitted right away.
Captain? I need to ask you something.
Ammunition?
Maybe...
I just authorized the logistics request. We'll get you more bullets, Wichita.
YAY!
Just try to make our current supplies last until the shipment arrives.
@BATTLE
The chapel was breathtaking. I'll never forget what it was like to walk inside.
The chapel? The beaches were the best part of the shore leave, if you ask me.
I'll bet the people on the beach were your favorite.
Um...
Ha! She's got you there! If I hadn't smacked you on the head, you would've been caught staring at the one with the sunglasses and red lipstick.
It's not like I could just go up and talk to her. I can't speak a lick of French.
Admiring from a distance, sometimes that's all we can do...
Exactly, Miss Wichita.
That chapel sounds nice, Officer Rahal. I only saw it from the pier, but it must have been lovely on the inside.
It was. The stonework was so...
Attention on deck!
Hello, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Sharing stories about shore leave?
Good to see everybody relaxing on the mess decks.
This conversation doesn't sound professional to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Your officers know how to enjoy shore leave, Captain.
Spending time together is important. Want to join us, Captain?
Just taking a break and sharing stories about our experiences, Captain.
It's time to get back to work. I need all hands on deck for the rendezvous with the supply ship. She's radioed that she's almost here.
We'll be ready.
On my way, Captain.
*ALARM*
Get to battle stations. If the Morganas are here, that means our supply ship could be in danger, too.
We need that ammo! I'll make sure the Morganas don't lay a finger on her, Captain!
@BATTLE
We kept our promise, Captain. The supply ship survived the Morgana attack.
A supply ship full of fuel, parts, and ammo, crawling along at ten knots... Too tempting for the Morganas to lay off, even with a heavy cruiser like us nearby.
Greedy little monsters.
But I'm parched, and my guns are critically light on ammunition. How long until we can start transferring fuel and ammo?
Officer Coltrain's last report said safety checks were complete. Refueling should be ready to commence in just a few minutes.
Glad to hear that!
You seem to be...

Fields.MenuText: ... doing better.
... pleased with yourself.
... hiding something.

Fields.DialogueText: Doing better? Was I doing bad before?
It feels good to know that we protected somebody. That supply ship can't defend herself the way that we can, Captain.
A Belle would be in the wrong to do something like that, Captain.
Don't exhaust yourself, Wichita. You're quick to shoulder a heavy load, but I don't want you to end up in the shipyard again.
Cuts and scrapes build character, don't you think? Besides, it takes a lot to poke a hole in all of my armor.
Cuts, scrapes, and thick armor - all qualities I find irresistible, Miss Wichita.
*ALARM*
Morganas interrupting our fun...
Again.
@BATTLE
Hmmm.
How about a cackle for a laugh? Would that make you even sweeter on me? *cackle*
Wichita?
With respect, Captain, I wouldn't go in there if I were you.
Oh? Why is that?
I don't mean to tell my captain where to go and where not to go, but Miss Wichita...

Fields.MenuText: Is she all right?
Are you all right?
You're damn right you don't tell me where to go.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure. I think she is, but I heard something through her door.
I'm... I'm fine, Captain. Thanks for asking, but I'm fine.
It's just that... Miss Wichita is talking to somebody in there.
Who?
That's just it, Captain. She's alone.
Nobody else went in or out, so either she's talking to herself or she's...
Or she's what?
Or she's casting a spell.
Enough of the witchcraft rumors, Officer Coltrain. Things like that won't do anybody any good on this ship.
Aye aye, Captain. Please forget that I even said that out loud.
Don't look so shaken. Head up to the bridge and relieve Officer Rahal. I'll take care of things here.
Yes, Captain.
Wichita? Hi, there...
I sense a presence. Something wicked approaches us...
Wichita?!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Listening outside of my cabin door? Really, Captain?
Don't try to make this into something it isn't, Wichita. There's no scandal here.
Who says I would have minded? Besides, I don't lock my door. Remember that if you feel a little braver next time.
You really don't lock your door?
No. I close the door for privacy, but I don't need to lock it. I have nothing to hide from the crew.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you afraid somebody will steal your popcorn machine?
I'm still not convinced that you aren't hiding something from me.
Good. If you slept through an alarm, it would be easier for a messenger to wake you up and get you to battle stations.

Fields.DialogueText: I always share my popcorn with the crew. That way, nobody would ever need to steal it.
Privacy isn't the same as keeping secrets, Captain.
Exactly.
All of this aside, we still need to talk about something before we approach Scapa Flow.
What is that, Captain? As your Belle, I am at your disposal.
Not long ago, one of the officers said that...
Said what, Captain?
Your popcorn machine. Oh, that smells...
Smells good, doesn't it? It helps cover up all of the diesel and sweaty sailor smells.
It smells amazing. I should admit, I associate the smell of fresh popcorn with you - and it's... well...
Let me propose something, Captain.
We'll share a little bit of popcorn and talk when it's quieter. For now, we just look into eachother's eyes while we wait. *giggle*
All right.
*BOOM*
Is something wrong with my popcorn machine?
That's not the popcorn machine. That's gunfire, Wichita!
Oh! Let's get going!
@BATTLE
Can you still see Ellis up there? Impressive.
My eyes are as keen as an eagle's, Captain.
But I will admit - even I sometimes lose sight of his plane in the fog.
Doesn't stop you from trying, though, does it?
Ha! Never. I love watching airplanes. Flying is so...

Fields.MenuText: Graceful?
Free?
Dangerous?

Fields.DialogueText: It's more than graceful. It's divine.
To soar among the clouds high above... What I wouldn't give to do that!
It wouldn't be dangerous for me.
Half of the crew probably thinks I can fly around on a broom, right? *cackle* Haha!
They're all cured of that rumor, last time I checked.
Then maybe I used a witch's hex to fool them... Hahahaha!
Yeah, right. You're just kidding when you say things like that. I'm learning to read that smile on your face, Wichita.
Maybe you really are figuring me out. Congratulations! And you're easy enough on the eyes, to boot. A Belle could do worse than a captain like you.
Quit gazing at my pretty face for a moment and look up. Right there. See the plane through the haze yet?
I think so...
I hope he got some good photographs today. Aerial reconnaissance could give us a good look at Morgana concentrations in the area.
Let Ellis and his plane do the work right now. Rest up and keep your eyes sharp for when it's our turn to be on the lookout.
Quit worrying, Captain. Staying up late never broke a Belle.
I promise I'll turn in once Ellis gets back.
Don't make me start enforcing bedtimes, Wichita.
Pffft.
You never know when you'll need your energy for the next problem coming over the horizon.
Stay up late with me sometime. Maybe I could change your mind?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Awww...
Not a single one.
Not a single what?
Not a single souvenir, Captain.
You mean from Scotland?
That's right. A shame we weren't able to pull into port and send the crew on some shore leave.
Ah. And that means none of them were able to shop for souvenirs for you.
I can only go about ten meters from the ship, so I have to ask them to shop for me. This time, however...

Fields.MenuText: We couldn't stop to make a port call. HQ's orders.
You really love your souvenirs, don't you?
The ten meter limit still bothers you a lot, doesn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: The crew deserved it, but I know it isn't always practical.
I do. It's the next best thing to sightseeing for myself.
I don't want to talk about that right now. It depresses me.
Is that why you talk to Ellis so much?
Exactly, Captain! I may not get any trinkets from a port call, but at least he could tell me about the mountains and the islands and everything else.
He could probably see the shipwrecks while he was flying his reconnaissance missions.
Did you know that during the first World War, ships were deliberately sunk around Scapa Flow to hinder intrusion by German submarines?
The blockships? Yes, but I heard some of those had fallen behind on their maintenance.
Some blocks of concrete would prove more permanent. Maybe that would do the trick.
Let's hope so. That might keep the Morganas out, too.
Maybe we can drive close to those wrecks next time, Captain. I could probably get close enough to see them if we did.
I'll have to think about it. I don't want us to become one of the wrecks.
Sigh... Speaking of old wrecks...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Wichita?
You are the prettiest, aren't you? Almost as pretty as my captain...
What?
The prettiest little seashell of all... Your colors are like a little magical rainbow...
Ahem! Wichita? Can I come in?
Sorry, I was...busy.

Fields.MenuText: Busy talking to yourself?
Busy talking to your precious souvenirs?
Relax, I didn't hear anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly.
How long were you listening at the door? Hear anything you liked? *cackle*
An answer like that means you heard something.
I was just enjoying my souvenirs. Sometimes I talk to them, so I didn't hear your first knock.
Your souvenirs from all of our port visits... they're really special to you, aren't they?
I can't go ashore, so this is all I can do to experience the places we visit.
I understand.
Do you really?
I can try. It makes sense.
Can you give me a moment, Captain? I know you came here to talk to me about something, but I need a little more time alone.
Sure. Meet me in the bridge in a few minutes?
I will, Captain. And sooner than that if Morganas show up.
Wish granted.
@BATTLE
Are these photographs important? None of them show any Morgana concentrations.
I didn't mean to hoard them. I was just admiring the views from the reconnaissance plane.
Ellis did a nice job, didn't he?
He did, Captain.
I was about to take these photos to the operations officer to update our intel plots.

Fields.MenuText: Hand them over, Wichita. Those are critical to our reconnaissance mission.
Maybe Wichita can keep one or two of the photos.
You have an unhealthy attachment to your souvenirs.

Fields.DialogueText: If I must...
That's quite thoughtful of you, Captain, but I know these are important.
Until I can fly in a plane for myself, this is the only way I can see sights like this.
Take all of the photos, Officer Coltrain.
Maybe we can get some unofficial photos from Ellis next time he flies.
I would appreciate that.
I know these things are important to you, Wichita. You can't go more than ten meters from the ship, and it must be difficult.
Your understanding is...
Are you all right?
It's comforting to me, my sweet Captain, but... *sniffle*
Let's talk about this later, Wichita.
Oh... yes, perhaps I need to inspect something by myself for a little while.
I'll be in my cabin whenever you want to talk some more.
I won't be long, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Steady on course zero nine zero, Captain. We'll arrive at the Strait of Gibraltar soon.
The entrance to the Mediterranean Sea. Just imagine all of the places we'll be able to visit!
You should hear the crew talk about it, Miss Wichita. They're all excited.
So am I. Captain, could we see Venice?
Or maybe Cairo?
Cairo! Captain, I'll submit the request to HQ immediately if you say the word!

Fields.MenuText: Go ahead and draft the port visit requests, but remember they're only that – requests.
I might have some pull with the foreign liaison. I'll see what I can arrange for us.
You do realize that this is a warship with a job to do, right?

Fields.DialogueText: No promises. Understood, Captain.
Would it help if I held my breath until then? Don't fault me if I try!
For now, focus on our patrol. Gibraltar is a narrow strait, and I'd rather we avoid smashing into the rocks.
Cairo...
Cairo...
Do you think I'll be able to see the pyramids from our anchorage?
Good question, Miss Wichita. I couldn't say without reviewing the charts first.
Did either of you hear what I just said?
Cairo...
Wichita, you do know that the ship might not be able to sail in the Nile because of its depth, right?
*ALARM*
Captain? Sorry, but if you were saying something it will have to wait. We've got Morganas on the horizon!
Sigh...
@BATTLE
Steady as she goes, Officer Coltrain.
Aye aye, Captain. We're pointed at the center of the Strait of Gibraltar.
Excellent. Keep us on this course, and we'll be through safely in no time. A sharp eye for enemy contacts while we transit, Wichita.
Wichita?
Look at him go! Do you see Ellis up there, Captain?
Ellis?
He took one of the reconnaissance planes up for a flight to watch our transit through the strait, and he's making a pass over the Rock of Gibraltar.
It's glorious, Captain.
Actually...

Fields.MenuText: ... I was concentrating on getting us through a dangerous, narrow strait. My attention is on the water.
... I stole a peek at the Rock of Gibraltar on the horizon just a minute ago. Breathtaking, isn't it?
Go make some popcorn if you're going sightseeing, Wichita. The rest of us have work to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I'll take in the sights for both of us, Captain.
Staggering, Captain. I hope Ellis got a few pictures for me.
Ouch! We're all performing our duties, Captain. I was trying to share something nice.
What an amazing view! If only I could climb to the top...
If it helps, none of us can climb that rock right now. Eyes on the horizon, please.
Point taken, Captain.
Visual contacts ahead. If they're merchants, they aren't moving out of the way for us.
Those aren't merchants, they're Morganas. Of all the places to get pinched! No way to maneuver out of this fight in the narrows.
Maybe they'd enjoy some souvenirs, too? Shells, perhaps? I have some 8-inch ones that my guns can deliver in a hurry!
That's the spirit, Wichita!
@BATTLE
Wichita, what's going on here?
Oh, hello, Captain! Notice anything different about the passageway?
"Anything different?" You're kidding. I wouldn't notice an entire corridor lined in planter boxes of sunflowers?
Walking through this drab corridor every day from the bridge to my cabin inspired me.
I gathered as many sunflowers as I could and placed them on either side of the passage.
Don't worry. I left enough room for people to walk through.

Fields.MenuText: You made an entire corridor of a warship into a botanical garden.
I like it.
How will sunflowers get enough light down here? Won't they die?

Fields.DialogueText: Is that an order to get rid of them?
"I like it." A hundred boxes of sunflowers in a passageway, and you say three words. You've mastered understatement and won my heart, for sure.
I have more boxes topside. I have a rotation system to make sure all of them get their share of sunlight.
When I get more flowers, I can decorate more places on the ship.
Just one question, Miss Wichita. How did you collect so many flowers? Did you bring these seeds with you from Norfolk?
I didn't have to. Sunflowers grow in the Mediterranean.
I couldn't go into town on shore leave, but the crew brought these to me. All it cost me was some popcorn...
And promising not to turn them into toads! *cackle* HA! HA! HA!
Just kidding, Captain. There's only one person on board I like enough to turn into a toad. Lucky you, sweetheart!
No...
Good, you softie!
Enemy contacts! Get our guns up!
@BATTLE
Charmed, Wichita.
Another Morgana pack?! Now I miss the Atlantic.
Oh? I thought you liked the calmer seas here.
Fighting in the Mediterranean heat works up a sweat. At least in the Atlantic I could shiver and freeze in a nice, cool storm.
*ALARM*
There goes Wichita again. Her non-stop firing makes it even hotter here.
Hope for a sea breeze while we fight.
@BATTLE
Whew!
You look like you're going to fall over, Wichita.
Tired...
It's all right for you to use my chair.
Is anybody watching? Don't want them to... see me winded...

Fields.MenuText: It doesn't matter if they do. Just sit down before you collapse.
Go find somewhere to rest where they can't see you. If they ask, I'll say you're busy.
You've pushed yourself way too hard. This is unhealthy.

Fields.DialogueText: What choice do I have?
No, I need to stay near the bridge in case another pack of Morganas arrives. It's decided then - I'll take that chair.
I'll be fine, let me catch my breath.
Ouch. This chair is far less comfortable than it looks.
The Captain's chair isn't supposed to be comfortable, Wichita.
Not as comfortable as I imagine a Captain's Lap could be - but right now it's better than nothing. Thanks, dearie.
Get as much rest as you can. Maybe we can try that other thing later.
Wichita? Did you hear me?
Zzzz... Zzzz...
I'll go find a blanket. I don't think she's going to leave that chair for a while.
Are you sure these inventories are correct?
Positive, Officer Rahal.
But, Miss Wichita, these numbers are far too low. We topped off our ammunition stores with the last supply ship, but...
But what? Don't worry about being polite.
We're nearly dry again.
The report's correct. I am a bit light.

Fields.MenuText: Ammunition is for shooting. It doesn't earn us interest in a bank if we save it.
Our consumption rate's alarming.
Noted.

Fields.DialogueText: And we can't borrow any from a bank when we run out.
What if we run out?
Not pointing fingers - just clarifying our situation.
Thanks for being thorough, Officer Rahal. I need to speak to Miss Wichita.
Aye, Captain.
Anything I need to know?
It's not an accusation. I just need to know if we have a problem.
The results matter, not the cost! I shoot exactly as much as I have to...
I just... have to shoot a lot. What am I supposed to do? NOT fight?!
Relax, Wichita. If I bill anybody for ammunition, I'm sending it to the Morganas.
Thanks, Captain. I take a lot of shots, and there's one more I really want to take.
Make them count. I'm counting on you.
Understood, dearest Captain.
@BATTLE
We'll ram them! My armor's thick.
Wichita? Are you awake? Wichita!
Zzzz... What? Huh?
Wichita?
First you tell me to get sleep, then you wake me up. What is it now?
Oh, no! I didn't sleep through an alarm, did I?

Fields.MenuText: No alarm... yet.
No, but at least you were sleeping. That's a change for the better.
Yes! Hurry! HURRY!

Fields.DialogueText: Yet?
I was until you woke me! Why bother me if there's no emergency?
Wait... if the alarm had sounded, everybody else would be setting general quarters. There's no alarm, is there?
Expect a big one soon. Ellis shot some aerial reconnaissance photos showing a major Morgana concentration.
They're bearing down on Algiers, and we're making good to intercept.
I waited as long as I could before I woke you, but according to their observed course and speed we'll encounter them soon.
I understand. I'll make every shot count.
*BOOM*
Are they practicing or starting without us?
They wouldn't waste the ammunition without a live target. It's Morganas.
Are you sure?
Positive. My witch's senses are tingling.
Your sense of humor is back, so you must be rested enough to fight!
@BATTLE
Starboard beam! Get the guns trained on the center of their line before we start shooting. Once they hear my shells, they're going to scatter quickly.
They're already moving, Miss Wichita.
They know we're here. We'll be in range any second now.
Don't let that Morgana gunfire scare you! My armor will keep you safe while we strike through these Morgana hags!
There's no end to them...
Enough to walk on their hulls all the way to Algiers without getting our feet wet.
Miss Wichita?
Yes?
I know you're not a witch, but if you were I wouldn't mind a little magic right now.
I've got a Belle's magic, Officer Coltrain.
I never get tired.
My armor never gets holes.
And I never run out of ammunition before the fight is over. Now get to your stations.
Yes, ma'am.
Aye aye, ma'am.

Fields.MenuText: Never get tired?
Armor never gets holes?
Never run out of ammunition?

Fields.DialogueText: I know my guns aren't so accurate when I'm tired, but I'm plenty rested for this one.
Ever see a shell punch through your cabin? Thank my steel plates for that.
Never before the fight is done.
I pushed myself hard yesterday so that I could push myself harder today.
I won't let you – or anybody else I care about – down. Never.
I know. I won't let you down, either.
You never have, Captain.
Ah! No more time to prepare. We've used it all up.
Fire when ready, Miss Wichita.
@BATTLE
If you did, then the fight WOULD be done.
Ha! Fair enough...
Don't look so disappointed, Captain. You gave it your best.
I tried my hardest, but it wasn't good enough.
The crew doesn't blame you. I don't blame you.
Even though we saved Algiers from a massive bombardment, there was no way the Germans would give us amnesty to visit Algiers.
Zurich's accord is a strange thing. We fight together against Morganas, regardless of our nationality. Once that fight is done, however...
They slam the door, and then threaten to shoot us through it.
Does it really bother you so much?

Fields.MenuText: I should have expected a port visit would've been impossible, but I had to try.
I wanted to give you a chance to do some sightseeing, even if only from the pier.
Your Captain came up empty-handed for you.

Fields.DialogueText: The crew would probably like Venice better anyway.
I've seen lots of places from the pier. Sometimes they just smell like dead fish.
I don't think that at all.
You gave me something better, I think.
A shared bag of popcorn off the coast of Sardinia? I can't imagine that on a travel brochure.
A safe anchorage, good weather, and clouds with faces and animals in them.
Maybe if we throw some popcorn, we'll get real seagulls.
Ha!
Are you all right? You must be exhausted after that last fight, but here you are trying to cheer me up.
I didn't need much rest, Captain. Something in this moment energizes me. I'm with...
With what?
With somebody that understands me, and understands what's in my heart.
You carry more in that heart than any Belle I've ever met.
It's strong enough, but now it's telling me something.
Something spooky?
Not something spooky! Something nice. It's telling me that I'm finally with somebody...
Somebody I have feelings for.
I'm well inside your 10-meter radius, Wichita. In fact, I'm close enough for you to take my hand.
I just might...
...as soon as you get it out of the popcorn bag.
Oh...
*giggle* Now let me prove that kissing won't turn you into a toad, no matter how many times we do it...
